wikipedia_page.main: Greg Avery  is a British animal rights activist.  His latest involvement is with Stop Huntingdon Animal Cruelty (SHAC), an international campaign to force the closure of Huntingdon Life Sciences (HLS), an animal testing company based in the UK and US.

response: From 2006, The Daily Telegraph reports, the British Government took the decision to tackle "the problem of animal rights extremism." On 1 May 2007, a police campaign called Operation Achilles was enacted against SHAC, a series of raids involving 700 police officers in England, Amsterdam, and Belgium."Britain's other war on terror", Spiegel online, 19 November 2007 In total, 32 people linked to the group were arrested,"Animal rights extremism – police arrest 32 people" , National Extremism Tactical Coordination Unit press release, 1 May 2007. and seven leading members of SHAC, including Greg Avery, were found guilty of blackmail."Activists in live testing trial deny blackmail", Financial Times 6 October 2008. Police estimated in 2007 that, as a consequence of the operation, "up to three quarters of the most violent activists" were jailed. Der Spiegel writes that the number of attacks on HLS and their business declined drastically but "the movement is by no means dead."
